summary: A painter on Dragonstone thinks Jon Snow has the perfect face
body:
A painter on Dragonstone thinks Jon Snow has the perfect face

I’m sitting here in bio, doodling some manga characters when it hits me

-There’s a painter on Dragonstone looking for the perfect male face to paint.

-Stannis displayed his art before he sailed for the wall and Daenerys finds it beautiful. He painted the island, the cliffs, the sea.

-He even painted her dragons.

Then

-Jon Snow arrives on the island.

-Painter thinks he has the perfect face. The perfect eyes. Perfect lips.

-He secretly asks if he can paint Jon and Jon reluctantly agrees after the painter gives a heartfelt speech of “waiting for the perfect man”

-Jon thinks the painter can find better men but doesn’t want to crush the painter’s spirits.

-Jon doesn’t want anyone to know so he goes to the painter’s workshop in secret.

Flash forward when Jon sails to Eastwatch

-Daenerys visits the painter to see if he has any more work.

-She goes into his house and is stunned by the painting of Jon. It captures his beautiful eyes and face perfectly.

-The painter remarks “it’s my finest work” and Daenerys agrees. She thinks it’s even better than his painting of her children.

-She asks the man to sell it to her and it confuses him. She lies that she will gift it to his sisters in Winterfell as a peace offering.

-The painter doesn’t want to sell it and she resorts to offering a chest filled to the brim with gold and jewels. The painter has a family to look after. He cannot refuse.

-He remarks that he hopes the King’s sisters will like it. Daenerys says she’s sure they will.

-It’s a lie. She’s payed a record fee for a painting she wants no one else to see but herself.

Post Boat Sex

-So caught up in the moment, Daenerys forgets she has his painting hung up on her wall directly across her bed.

-After lying down to rest, Jon opens his eyes and sees the painting.

“Huh, so that’s what happened to it” he says.

I need to stop making up ideas and listen to this cell anatomy

summary:
When Jon died with Castle Black and Dany heard Wolf’s voice in Dothraki sea
And she has her first moon blood 
“When the sun...
body:
When Jon died with Castle Black and Dany heard Wolf’s voice in Dothraki sea

And she has her first moon blood

“When the sun rises in the west and sets in the east. When the seas go dry and mountains blow in the wind like leaves. When your womb quickens again, and you bear a living child. “

summary:
Jon: Are you upset you don't get to be on the same training team as Arya?
Gendry: Have you ever trained with Arya?
Jon:...
body:
Jon: Are you upset you don’t get to be on the same training team as Arya?

Gendry: Have you ever trained with Arya?

Jon: No

Gendry: Have you ever gone into a steel cage with wolverine?

*cuts to Arya and Pod*

Arya [to Podrick]: FASTER! FASTER! FASTER! FASTER! DO YOU NOT KNOW THAT WORD?! IT MEANS MORE FAST!

summary: GOT S8 Teaser: What can we observe in this teaser? Jon, walking past Lyanna’s statue.  Voiceover reminds us of a Stark pledge to...
body:
GOT S8 Teaser: What can we observe in this teaser?

Jon, walking past Lyanna’s statue.  Voiceover reminds us of a Stark pledge to PROTECT Jon from ambitious, ruthless monarchs.   

Sansa, walking past her mother’s statue.  Voiceover reminds us of Catelyn’s grief over her (show invention) inability to LOVE Jon, suggesting Sansa will correct her mother’s regret.  

Jon, walking past the statue of the man who raised him. Voiceover reminds us that Jon is a STARK.  

Three Starks gather in front of their own statues, reminded of their own mortality. A threat grows, extinguishing the fire Jon was clinging to.  Three Starks turn to face the threat.  

We know a fight is coming.  The freezing air that approaches is coming for them.  But it’s is coming for them not on the battlefield, or on the ramparts.  It’s coming for them in the crypts.  The place where thousands of years of Starks are buried. Make no mistake, this is a STARK fight.  It’s a fight they’ve fought before.  The secret to fighting it again lies not in a fiery outsider.  The secret to this fight is written in the crypts, in the very bones of the Starks.

summary:
Jon: So, how’s Gendry? 
Arya: Well, last week he was supposed to make some horseshoes, but instead he made animal biscuit...
body:
Jon: So, how’s Gendry?

Arya: Well, last week he was supposed to make some horseshoes, but instead he made animal biscuit cutters. Now everything we eat is shaped like either a bull’s head or a wolf. He’s so stupid. I love him.

reblog.comment:
Jon: So, how’s Gendry?

Arya: Well, last week he was supposed to make some horseshoes, but instead he made animal biscuit cutters. Now everything we eat is shaped like either a bull’s head or a wolf. He’s so stupid. I love him.

title: Romance Over Rivalry: The Benefits of a Jon/Sansa Marriage
excerpt: “When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.” —Eddard Stark, A Game of Thrones With Game of Thrones barre...
description: It’s often said that Game of Thrones isn’t about happy endings. But personally, I don’t see why not. The good guys and the innocents are constantly beaten down, so it would be satisfying to flip the script and end with their triumph. After all these characters have been through, there’s no sense in an end in which they all die or continue to suffer. While the endgame may not be neat and tidy, it likely won’t be all devastation, either. This series is about perseverance in the face of loss, and inner strength that overcomes adversity. For our heroes to come this far just to crash and burn would render the narrative almost pointless.

After all these characters have been through, there’s no sense in an end in which they all die or continue to suffer. While the endgame may not be neat and tidy, it likely won’t be all devastation, either. This series is about perseverance in the face of loss, and inner strength that overcomes adversity. For our heroes to come this far just to crash and burn would render the narrative almost pointless.

summary: Q: “If you could bring back one character from the dead, who would you choose?” A: “I'd bring back Robb Stark and his mother...
body:
Q: “If you could bring back one character from the dead, who would you choose?”

A: “I’d bring back Robb Stark and his mother Catelyn just because I really miss Richard Madden and Michelle Fairley, who played them. Richard and I are still best mates. And Ygritte would come back, of course. I think Jon’s never been happier than when he was with her - and I don’t think he ever will be.”

- Kit Harington on Game of Thrones for TV & Satellite, 2019

reblog.comment:

A: “I’d bring back Robb Stark and his mother Catelyn just because I really miss Richard Madden and Michelle Fairley, who played them. Richard and I are still best mates. And Ygritte would come back, of course. I think Jon’s never been happier than when he was with her - and I don’t think he ever will be.”

- Kit Harington on Game of Thrones for TV & Satellite, 2019

And Ygritte would come back, of course. I think Jon’s never been happier than when he was with her - and I don’t think he ever will be.”

- Kit Harington on Game of Thrones for TV & Satellite, 2019

Pretty much Game of Throne and Jonsa all day, every day. 
Avatar and header by @ragekitn

summary: I think Jon would once again give up on life once he gets the news of his parentage but it would be sansa's  kidnapping that...
question: I think Jon would once again give up on life once he gets the news of his parentage but it would be sansa's  kidnapping that would once again give him strength get his shit together.. but I could be wrong
answer:
Hey, nonnie!

I think you’re optimistic. :))))

What I mean by that is: I don’t think Jon is planning on living past the WW war so he’s already given up on life. At every turn, since season 6, he’s questioned why he was brought back and the only answer anyone could give him (Davos, Melisandre and Beric) is vaguely related to the WWs and, as Davos put it, “sweeping up their shit”. So Jon, I think, assumes that the Red God brought him back to fight against the WWs . What is motivating Jon at the moment is fighting for the people he loves and for humanity as a whole. He is trying to bring all these factions together for the sole reason of fighting the WWs and accepts the fact that he’s going to be dead by the end of the conflict. 

One of the reasons why I placed the Jonsa reveal and secret wedding prior the battle with the WWs in my speculation post was precisely because of this. The parentage reveal isn’t going to make Jon give up on life because he’s already in that state. It’s just going to aggravate his mental state . But it’s also the source of his deliverance in a way. 

Imagine the following Jon theoretical thought process: 

I’m going to die in the war against the WWs so: 

It doesn’t matter that I pretended to bend the knee to D*ny or pledged her my sword. I won’t be alive when the time comes for her to hold me to my promise. 

It doesn’t matter that I pretended to love her or sleep with her because I’ll be dead soon so she’ll never find out.

It doesn’t matter that I’m in love with Sansa and I’m never going to be with her because she’s my sister. I’ll be dead soon, she’ll never find out and I won’t have to watch her marry and be happy with someone else. 

And then the parentage reveal happens … Jon finds out that he’s not a bastard, he’s the heir to the IT and D*ny’s direct opposition. He also finds out that him and Sansa aren’t siblings and that she loves him back. In my scenario, by the end of ep 2, they’re even married and Jon finally gets his deepest wish come true and is now a Stark. 

All of that doesn’t change the fact that Jon still believes he’s going to die in the impending war. But rather than that thought bringing him comfort and allowing him to make morally grey decisions while escaping accountability, he is now feeling doomed because he’s going to die and not get to live the life he’s always wanted with Sansa. He’s going to leave her alone and heartbroken. That type of inner conflict feels very bittersweet to me. 

So what happens when the battle is over, the WWs are defeated and Jon Snow is still standing? Well, I’d imagine the amount of relief and happiness he’s going to feel at that particular moment is going to be overwhelming. Finally he’s gotten rid of this burden that has been weighing on him since he was brought back. And now, if he can just fix the D*ny situation, he’ll get to live a happy, long life with Sansa. Yay!

Except … just as he is feeling hopefully and victorious, he finds out that Sansa has been kidnapped. All this time he thought he was going to be the one to die but it’s Sansa that ends up in mortal danger. Jon Snow is going to lose his shit! :))))

Of course, this is all just speculation on my part but that’s why we’re all here, isn’t it?

Thanks for the ask!

reblog.comment:
Hey, nonnie!

I think you’re optimistic. :))))

What I mean by that is: I don’t think Jon is planning on living past the WW war so he’s already given up on life. At every turn, since season 6, he’s questioned why he was brought back and the only answer anyone could give him (Davos, Melisandre and Beric) is vaguely related to the WWs and, as Davos put it, “sweeping up their shit”. So Jon, I think, assumes that the Red God brought him back to fight against the WWs . What is motivating Jon at the moment is fighting for the people he loves and for humanity as a whole. He is trying to bring all these factions together for the sole reason of fighting the WWs and accepts the fact that he’s going to be dead by the end of the conflict. 

One of the reasons why I placed the Jonsa reveal and secret wedding prior the battle with the WWs in my speculation post was precisely because of this. The parentage reveal isn’t going to make Jon give up on life because he’s already in that state. It’s just going to aggravate his mental state . But it’s also the source of his deliverance in a way. 

Imagine the following Jon theoretical thought process: 

I’m going to die in the war against the WWs so: 

It doesn’t matter that I pretended to bend the knee to D*ny or pledged her my sword. I won’t be alive when the time comes for her to hold me to my promise. 

It doesn’t matter that I pretended to love her or sleep with her because I’ll be dead soon so she’ll never find out.

It doesn’t matter that I’m in love with Sansa and I’m never going to be with her because she’s my sister. I’ll be dead soon, she’ll never find out and I won’t have to watch her marry and be happy with someone else. 

And then the parentage reveal happens … Jon finds out that he’s not a bastard, he’s the heir to the IT and D*ny’s direct opposition. He also finds out that him and Sansa aren’t siblings and that she loves him back. In my scenario, by the end of ep 2, they’re even married and Jon finally gets his deepest wish come true and is now a Stark. 

All of that doesn’t change the fact that Jon still believes he’s going to die in the impending war. But rather than that thought bringing him comfort and allowing him to make morally grey decisions while escaping accountability, he is now feeling doomed because he’s going to die and not get to live the life he’s always wanted with Sansa. He’s going to leave her alone and heartbroken. That type of inner conflict feels very bittersweet to me. 

So what happens when the battle is over, the WWs are defeated and Jon Snow is still standing? Well, I’d imagine the amount of relief and happiness he’s going to feel at that particular moment is going to be overwhelming. Finally he’s gotten rid of this burden that has been weighing on him since he was brought back. And now, if he can just fix the D*ny situation, he’ll get to live a happy, long life with Sansa. Yay!

Except … just as he is feeling hopefully and victorious, he finds out that Sansa has been kidnapped. All this time he thought he was going to be the one to die but it’s Sansa that ends up in mortal danger. Jon Snow is going to lose his shit! :))))

Of course, this is all just speculation on my part but that’s why we’re all here, isn’t it?

Thanks for the ask!

summary: Kit Harington diz que elenco chorou de exaustão e alegria na última temporada
title: Kit Harington diz que elenco chorou de exaustão e alegria na última temporada
body:
Kit Harington diz que elenco chorou de exaustão e alegria na última temporada

“Jon Snow fala sobre dedicação, privação de sono e cansaço durante filmagens”

Em entrevista para a revista GQ da Austrália, Kit Harington falou sobre o processo de gravação da última etapa da saga, afirmando que grande parte do elenco chegou à exaustão em diversos momentos:

“A última temporada da série parece que foi feita para nos destruir, estava todo mundo acabado no final. Eu não sei se…

View On WordPress
